title: Kuina Is Still Alive Theory
theory: Despite the official story that Kuina died from falling down stairs, some fans theorize that she may still be alive. Evidence includes: (1) the suspicious nature of her death being too random for One Piece's narrative style, (2) a mysterious woman appearing in later arcs who could be Kuina, and (3) possible cloning by the World Government to train her as a deadly swordsman.
author: Various One Piece fans

popularityMetrics.engagement: High - frequently discussed in One Piece communities

theorySupportingEvidence: Kuina's death from falling down stairs seems narratively inconsistent
Mysterious woman in Elbaph arc may be Kuina
World Government cloning technology could explain her return
theoryCounterEvidence: Oda has not officially confirmed this theory
Zoro's character development is built on her being deceased

title: Zoro Will Train a Female Successor Theory
theory: After Zoro achieves his dream of becoming the World's Greatest Swordsman, he will take in a female student to train as his successor, fulfilling his promise to Kuina in a new way. The most commonly theorized candidate is Mocha from Punk Hazard.
author: Various One Piece fans
theorySupportingEvidence: Would honor Kuina's memory and their shared dream
Zoro has shown protective instincts toward children
Thematically satisfying conclusion to Zoro's arc
theoryCounterEvidence: No concrete evidence in the manga yet

title: Zoro Gets Lost Due to Kuina's Death Theory
theory: Some fans theorize that Zoro's infamous poor sense of direction is psychologically linked to losing Kuina - he lost his way when he lost her, and this manifests as a literal inability to navigate.
author: Various One Piece fans
theorySupportingEvidence: Zoro shows navigation skills in Episode 2 before Kuina's full backstory is revealed
Psychological trauma can manifest in various ways
Thematically connects to his character arc
theoryCounterEvidence: Zoro's directional challenges appear to be comedic rather than psychological
May be reading too much into a running gag
